{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3465852,"name":"melih","username":"mely","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mely/{size}/240086_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T19:57:22.580Z","cooked":"

When the Limelight camera on our robot gets knocked out of position during a match, it disrupts our alignment and tracking. What methods or tools do you use to quickly and accurately recenter your Limelight? Are there any preventive measures or adjustments to secure it better during gameplay?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T19:57:22.580Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":30,"reads":396,"readers_count":395,"score":259.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"melih","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6985 Mechanic Captain"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/1","custom_user_title":"6985 Mechanic Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3465862,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T20:11:23.320Z","cooked":"

How are you mounting it? 2928 typically uses rigid mounts that have no adjustment once we decide how we want the camera to be positioned. Last year, the mounts were 3d printed and multiple identical copies were made. During an off-season event, the mount was broken, and we were able to reinstall it with a new mount with no issues.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T20:11:23.320Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":186.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Kevin Hjelstrom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 2928"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 2928","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3465876,"name":"melih","username":"mely","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mely/{size}/240086_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T20:29:12.406Z","cooked":"

We are currently using an angle-adjustable holder for the Limelight camera. The adjustment mechanism consists of a metal bolt and nut, which allows precise angle positioning. However, the rest of the holder is made of 3D-printed plastic, making it less durable. During high-impact situations or frequent adjustments, the plastic components tend to break easily, causing the system to fail despite the sturdiness of the metal parts.

Screenshot_20241231_232706_eDrawings2340×1080 246 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T20:29:12.406Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":350,"readers_count":349,"score":85.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"melih","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24441,"username":"KH987","name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6985 Mechanic Captain"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/3","custom_user_title":"6985 Mechanic Captain","reactions":[{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3465878,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T20:31:40.516Z","cooked":"

Once you figure out the angle you want, could you use a digital protractor to find that (currently adjusted) angle and make a fixed-angle piece of solid-ish plastic to mount it?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T20:31:40.516Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":321,"readers_count":320,"score":154.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69103,"username":"mely","name":"melih","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mely/{size}/240086_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/4","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3465881,"name":"Kevin Hjelstrom","username":"KH987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kh987/{size}/182255_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T20:35:48.265Z","cooked":"

Once you have an angle decided, do you still need the adjustment? Could you design a mount that matches the desired angle without adjustment? That should make it more sturdy. For example, use the existing mount to find what angle works best, measure the actual angle, then design a stationary one that matches the position.

What materials are you printing the parts out of? I have had success with PLA parts, but I’ve been moving in the direction of PA-CF. 3D printed parts should be able to survive bumper on bumper collisions, but most 3d printed mounts will break if they are the contact point.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T20:35:48.265Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":97.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Kevin Hjelstrom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69103,"username":"mely","name":"melih","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mely/{size}/240086_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 2928"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/5","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 2928","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3465985,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T23:15:27.648Z","cooked":"

Design a stiffer mount. For as much as stiff mechanisms matter, stiff camera mounts matter more. The limelight mount should be the stiffest thing on the robot, its accuracy is more important than the mechanism it is sending data to, because slight misalignments in the limelight position can cause large errors.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T23:15:27.648Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466067,"name":"Trevor Dayal (he/him)","username":"TrevDay","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trevday/{size}/268067_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T04:13:36.707Z","cooked":"

I actually think rigid mounts may be worse than compliant mounts.

FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2024 Build Thread FRC Open Alliance
In fact, we want camera mounts that can flop around a bit. Here’s what the mounts were like on our 2023 robot (the image to the left, not the right): [Camera Mount][Reference] Since we prefer to put cameras directly on top of swerve modules, they’re very exposed to collisions with other robots and the field. Our first several iterations of mount were rigid, and we went through at least one set per driver practice session while colliding with various objects… The flexible mounts just bend ou…

We used onyx for our camera mounts, but i’d guess over time collisions could deform the mounting structure, making every future reading at a competition incorrect.

But yeah, i’d find a good angle (maybe with prototype), and then print a final rigid, non-configurable part .

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T04:13:36.707Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":193.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Trevor Dayal (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-6328-mechanical-advantage-2024-build-thread/442736/414","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC 6328 Mechanical Advantage 2024 Build Thread","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"Regular","title_is_group":false,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59182,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"happy day!"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/7","custom_user_title":"happy day!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466069,"name":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427 | FIRST Business Development Manager","username":"Isriah","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isriah/{size}/194883_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T04:23:38.087Z","cooked":"

My understanding is that 6328’s camera mounts are compliant because they’re exposed on their swerve pods, and they can deflect and bounce back after an impact, rather than snapping off. For a camera mounted higher / inside of the robot, a rigid mount is better.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T04:24:29.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":84.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427 | FIRST Business Development Manager","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59182,"username":"TrevDay","name":"Trevor Dayal (he/him)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/trevday/{size}/268067_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56826,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/8","custom_user_title":"RoboLancers 321 | LANCE-A-LOT 427","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466101,"name":"Andrew Lawrence","username":"Andrew_L","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_l/{size}/270442_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T05:27:44.259Z","cooked":"

Bro I can’t even recenter myself when I’ve fallen off.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T05:27:44.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":213.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Andrew Lawrence","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28413,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Yo! Champ in the making!"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/9","custom_user_title":"Yo! Champ in the making!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466137,"name":"Josh Sirota","username":"gdgr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/f1d935/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T07:38:50.081Z","cooked":"

I don’t even understand the question (though maybe because we don’t use Limelights). Isn’t the right question “How do I make mounts that don’t fall off?”

I agree with the comment that once you figure out the ideal positioning of the camera, 3D-print something that isn’t adjustable (if that was the problem). We made our initial camera mounts in 2024 with several holes so that we could find something that worked well, then later versions didn’t have any alternate choices at all.

One tip (that we didn’t do last year, but should have): if you have mirror-image mounts on either side of the robot, put the “L” or “R” or something other indication of where they go right into the CAD.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T07:38:50.081Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Josh Sirota","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56244,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 co-lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/10","custom_user_title":"6238 co-lead mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466138,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T07:55:37.516Z","cooked":"
gdgr:

One tip (that we didn’t do last year, but should have): if you have mirror-image mounts on either side of the robot, put the “L” or “R” or something other indication of where they go right into the CAD.

Also, add a date or version number or angle or similar info that you might want to reference quickly if you’re thinking you might change it later. That way you can tell which of the 20 camera mounts floating around is the version you’re looking for without needing to measure.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T07:55:37.516Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/11","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466139,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T07:58:21.657Z","cooked":"

My general rule of thumb is: “Anything that CAN adjust WILL adjust, usually when you least want it to.”

As others have said, find the angle you want, then 3D print a hard mount.

For that matter, usually I don’t even deal with the adjustment on a physical camera, we mock up the camera location in CAD with an estimated FOV model, then use that to get the rough position we’re looking for and the programmers figure the rest out. If you’re robot is already in CAD, it’s pretty easy to download the field model and drop it in to estimate positions.

I suppose if you were trying to get a really specific angle to avoid an obstructing component on the robot I might consider a temporary adjustable mount, but usually we just print a whole new model if something is off a bit.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T08:07:13.412Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466143,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T08:09:38.534Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

My general rule is: “Anything that CAN adjust WILL adjust, usually when you least want it to.”

You just reminded me of an incident from a few years ago.

If you look at 1197’s performance In Galileo 2016, we were inconsistent to say the least with our shooting, 4-6 record in quals. But, what you might notice is that we suddenly improved late on Day 2. What happened?

Our camera was on an adjustable mount. Somehow, that mount had shifted between our previous event(s) and Galileo quals. This meant that most of our shots were off-line and if you know anything about our shooter that year it was a LINE shot, and hard. We’d been troubleshooting for a while when this was noticed; after realigning and redialing, we started hitting more shots. Put together just enough to be noticed by the #1 alliance (and I think borrowing 987’s “target on a pole” helped out with that), and powered our way to Einstein.

We’ve used “That ain’t goin’ NOWHERE!” mounts for the camera ever since.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-01T08:09:38.534Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477778,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-recenter-your-limelight-when-it-falls-off/477778/13","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466150,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-01T08:42:18.974Z","cooked":"

Even non-adjustable camera mounts are problematic, in 2022 division elims, my team suffered a sudden accuracy decrease due to a poor limelight mount. Our shooter was designed to be incredibly stiff, but we used a limelight on a pole to avoid camera blocking defense and to extend our FOV, which lead to stiffness issues but not enough care was put into it. Some combination of the tube yielding, screws slipping (because screws are not pins) and the 3d printed CFny mount deforming caused our auto-aim to fail and miss shots, forcing us to play sole defense instead of a hybrid strategy, contributing to a pair of losses an an early elimination.

I would generally suggest a solid metal or composite camera mount which is strong and stiff enough to not yield under impact or deform significantly under acceleration, and put significant care into designing in proper locating features to reduce any tolerance stackup that ends up reaching the camera. Fractions of a degree matter, especially with the simpler tracking algorithms.
